extra.text: The menu screen comprises all of the buttons and text for both the main menu and the pause menu.  It is the interface that allows players to change options such as the game language and resource pack active, as well as create a new
or join a multiplayer server. Upon the opening of the game's menu, the game's logo will appear with a
caption beneath it. The game's menu can be accessed anytime in-game by pausing the game, with the {{Key
By default, there are 6 buttons in the title screen menu
.  In the background, there is a constantly moving, blurred image of a
world with distinguishable features. The map shown can be edited with the use of a resource pack.
A more in-depth tutorial is currenty being made, and can be accessed
Choose a world to play, or make one.
Allows you to set the game
Choose a world to play, or make one.
There is a one in 10,000 chance that the title screen will display "Minceraft" instead of "Minecraft".

made it as a small secret, and enjoyed that he was the only one who knew of its existence. After stating a secret was in Minecraft undiscovered, the internet went wild, trying to find it. Soon after, Notch wrote an article called,
In crash logs, a reference to Minceraft may appear as a joke, stating, "You should try our sister game, Minceraft
The menu screen was added. It originally displayed a dirt background.}}
Added animation of the logo. The animation was cobblestone zooming out in order to form the word "Minecraft".}}
The logo animation was removed as such.}}
Completely revamped the title screen adding an animated background, a version tag in the bottom left corner and new options in the option menu.}}
Added "Re-Create" option to the World selection menu.}}
The "Texture Packs" button has been moved to the "Options..." screen.}}
" button is moved to the main screen, taking the spot of the "Texture Packs" button.}}
